file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 53-01-03-04 - BAGGAGE-COMPARTMENT FLOOR PANELS - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL BAGGAGE-COMPARTMENT FLOOR PANELS - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the Baggage-Compartment Floor Panels. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY BAGGAGE-COMPARTMENT FLOOR PAN- ALL 53-01-03-000-801-A ELS - REMOVAL BAGGAGE-COMPARTMENT FLOOR PAN- ALL 53-01-03-400-801-A ELS - INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 53-01-03 Page 1 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 53-01-03-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. BAGGAGE-COMPARTMENT FLOOR PANELS - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the instructions to remove the Baggage-Compartment Floor Panels. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 - AMM SDS 52-30-00/1 BAGGAGE-COMPARTMENT ANTI-BLOCKAGE BAR- AMM TASK 25-50-01-000-801-A/400 RIER - REMOVAL AMM TASK 25-50-02-000-801-A/400 CARGO NET ASSEMBLY - REMOVAL AMM TASK 25-50-03-000-802-A/400 CARGO LOADING/UNLOADING RAMP - REMOVAL AMM TASK 25-51-01-000-801-A/400 BAGGAGE COMPARTMENT LINING - REMOVAL BAGGAGE-COMPARTMENT FLOOR LINING - RE- AMM TASK 25-51-04-000-801-A/400 MOVAL C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 170 Fuselage rear section I D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Torque wrench To tighten the screws available E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Protective Gloves For protection of technician's hands 1 available Commercially Safety Goggles For protection of technician's eyes 1 available F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) MIL-PRF-680, TYPE I Solvent or equivalent AR TT-I-735 Isopropyl alcohol AR EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 53-01-03 Page 2 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task In the baggage compartment I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Open the baggage compartment door (AMM SDS 52-30-00/1). (2) Disconnect the cargo-door anti-blockage barrier from the cargo loading/unloading ramp, the cargo compartment lining, and the baggage-compartment floor lining ( AMM TASK 25-50-01-000-801-A/400). (3) Remove the cargo restraint net and the anchor plate ( AMM TASK 25-50-02-000-801- A/400). (4) Remove the floor angle ( AMM TASK 25-51-01-000-801-A/400). (5) Remove the floor finish fittings ( AMM TASK 25-51-04-000-801-A/400) to remove floor panels 271AF, 271BF, and 271FF (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100). (6) Remove the cargo loading/unloading ramp (AMM TASK 25-50-03-000-802-A/400) to remove floor panels 271BF and 271FF (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100). (7) Remove the baggage-compartment floor lining ( AMM TASK 25-51-04-000-801-A/400). J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Remove the screws (2) that attach the protection plate (1) to the baggage- compartment floor beams to remove floor panel 271FF. (2) Remove the protection plates (1) to remove floor panel 271FF. (3) Remove the screws (4) that attach the floor panel (3) to the baggage-compartment floor beams. (4) Remove the floor panel (3). (5) Examine the polyethylene tape on floor panels for general condition. If it is necessary, replace the tape with a new one. (a) Discard the old polyethylene tape. WARNING: MIL-PRF-680 TYPE I SOLVENT IS CLASSIFIED AS A FLAMMABLE PRODUCT, DO NOT USE IN TEMPERATURES ABOVE 38ÃÂ°C (100ÃÂ°F). ASSURE PROPER VENTILATION TO USE IN ANY AIRCRAFT AREA. (6) With a cloth soaked in solvent, clean the surface butt straps of floor structure for remove the old CIC. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 53-01-03 Page 3 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL WARNING: BE CAREFUL WHEN YOU USE SOLVENTS BECAUSE THEY ARE A HEALTH AND FIRE HAZARD. USE SAFETY GOGGLES AND PROTECTIVE CLOTHING WHEN YOU HANDLE THEM. DO NOT BREATHE THEIR GASES AND WORK IN A WELL VENTILATED AREA. (7) With a clean cloth soaked in Isopropyl alcohol, clean all floor panels where the work will be done. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 53-01-03 Page 4 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Baggage-Compartment Floor Panels - Removal/Installation Figure 401 A ZONES 171 172 C B DET. A 1. PROTECTION PLATE 1 2 2. SCREW 1 2 4. SCREW 3. FLOOR PANEL DET. B DET. C 1 TORQUE: 1.8 - 2.9 N.m (16 - 26 lb.in) 2 THE SCREWS MUST BE WET WITH COR-BAN 27L. EM145AMM530027C.DGN EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 53-01-03 Page 5 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Floor Panel Protection to Prevent Corrosion Figure 402 A 2 A A A 1 TYPICAL DETAIL 2 30 (REF.) 60 1 SECTION AA 1 INSTALL ADHESIVE POLYETHILENE TAPE ALONG THE CONTOUR OF THE FLOOR PANELS AS INDICATED 2 INSTALL A BLACK FOAM SHAPE (3 x 20 mm) ALONG THE CONTOUR OF THE FLOOR PANELS AS INDICATED DIMENSIONS IN mm 145AMM530202.MCE EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 53-01-03 Page 6 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 53-01-03-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. BAGGAGE-COMPARTMENT FLOOR PANELS - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the instructions to install the Baggage-Compartment Floor Panels. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 - AMM SDS 52-30-00/1 BAGGAGE-COMPARTMENT ANTI-BLOCKAGE BAR- AMM TASK 25-50-01-400-801-A/400 RIER - INSTALLATION AMM TASK 25-50-02-400-801-A/400 CARGO NET ASSEMBLY - INSTALLATION CARGO LOADING/UNLOADING RAMP - INSTALLA- AMM TASK 25-50-03-400-802-A/400 TION AMM TASK 25-51-01-400-801-A/400 BAGGAGE COMPARTMENT LINING - INSTALLATION BAGGAGE-COMPARTMENT FLOOR LINING - IN- AMM TASK 25-51-04-400-801-A/400 STALLATION CPM 51-61-00 - IPC 53-01-01 COCKPIT FLOOR IPC 53-01-02 PASSENGER CABIN FLOOR C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 170 Fuselage rear section I D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Torque wrench To tighten the screws available Commercially Acrylic spatula To install polyurethane film available E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Protective Gloves For protection of technician's hands 1 available Commercially Safety Goggles For protection of technician's eyes 1 available EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 53-01-03 Page 7 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) MEP 09-075 Corrosion-Inhibiting Compound (COR-BAN 27L) AR MEP 10-063 Corrosion-Inhibiting Compound (Dinitrol AV-30) AR TT-I-735 Isopropyl alcohol AR G. Expendable Parts IPC REFERENCE ITEM QTY (VENDOR REFERENCE) PI335 Preto AE-AA3x20MM (Black foam shape (3 x IPC 53-01-02 AR 20 mm)) 5421-100 mm (Polyethylene Tape) IPC 53-01-02 AR Floor Panel IPC 53-01-01 AR H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task In the baggage compartment I. Installation (Figure 401) (Figure 402) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) If there is a polyethylene tape on the butt straps on floor structure and it is damaged, do this step: (2) Apply Dinitrol AV-30 and the new polyethylene tape on the butt straps of floor structure in the Baggage areas according to CPM 51-61-00. (3) If there is a black foam shape (3 x 20 mm) on the floor panel edges and it is damaged, refer to (Figure 402) and do these steps: (a) Cut the damaged portion of the black foam shape (3 x 20 mm) and discard it. NOTE: Make sure that the polyethylene tape is not damaged. (b) Install a new portion of the black foam shape (3 x 20 mm). (4) If there is a polyethylene tape on the floor panel edges and it is damaged, refer to (Figure 402) and do these steps: (a) Apply the new polyethylene tape and, with aid of an acrylic spatula, remove the bubbles. NOTE: Protect with the same tape the bottom part of the floor panel insert which will be in contact with the floor structure. (b) Install a new black foam shape (3 x 20 mm). (5) Install the floor panel (3). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 53-01-03 Page 8 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL WARNING: COR-BAN 27L IS TOXIC TO SKIN, EYES, AND RESPIRATORY TRACT. USE PVC GLOVES AND EYE PROTECTION. USE ONLY IN WELL VENTILATED AREAS. OBEY THE MANUFACTURER’S HEALTH AND SAFETY INSTRUCTIONS. (6) Install the screws (4) that attach the floor panel (3) to the baggage-compartment floor beams. The screws must be wet with COR-BAN 27L. (7) Tighten the screws (1). NOTE: Apply torque of 1.8 - 2.9 N.m (16 - 26 lbf.in). (8) Install floor panel 271FF as follows: (a) Install the floor panel (3). WARNING: COR-BAN 27L IS TOXIC TO SKIN, EYES, AND RESPIRATORY TRACT. USE PVC GLOVES AND EYE PROTECTION. USE ONLY IN WELL VENTILATED AREAS. OBEY THE MANUFACTURER’S HEALTH AND SAFETY INSTRUCTIONS. (b) Install the screws (4) that attach the floor panel (3) to the baggage-compartment floor beams. The screws must be wet with COR-BAN 27L. (c) Install the protection plates (1). (d) Install the screws (2) that attach the protection plate (1) to the baggage- compartment floor beams. (e) Tighten the screws (4) and (2). NOTE: Apply torque of 1.8 - 2.9 N.m (16 - 26 lbf.in). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Install the baggage-compartment floor lining ( AMM TASK 25-51-04-400-801-A/400). (2) Install the cargo loading/unloading ramp (AMM TASK 25-50-03-400-802-A/400) if you removed floor panels 271BF and 271FF (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100). (3) Install the floor finish fittings ( AMM TASK 25-51-04-400-801-A/400) if you removed floor panels 271AF, 271BF and 271FF (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100). (4) Install the floor angle ( AMM TASK 25-51-01-400-801-A/400). (5) Install the anchor plate and the cargo restraint net ( AMM TASK 25-50-02-400-801-A/ 400). (6) Connect the cargo-door anti-blockage barrier to the cargo loading/unloading ramp, the cargo compartment lining, and the baggage-compartment floor lining ( AMM TASK 25-50-01-400-801-A/400). (7) Close the baggage compartment door (AMM SDS 52-30-00/1). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 53-01-03 Page 9 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
